verses.verse: For the Chief Musician. Maschil of David; when Doeg the Edomite came and told Saul, and said unto him, David is come to the house of Ahimelech. Why boastest <WH1984> thou thyself in mischief <WH7451>, O mighty <WH1368> man <WH2617>? The lovingkindness of God <WH410> endureth continually <WH3117>.
Thy tongue <WH3956> deviseth <WH2803> very wickedness <WH1942>, Like a sharp <WH3913> razor <WH8593>, working <WH6213> deceitfully <WH7423>.
Thou lovest <WH157> evil <WH7451> more than good <WH2896>, And lying <WH8267> rather than to speak <WH1696> righteousness <WH6664>. <WH5542>[[Selah
Thou lovest <WH157> all devouring <WH1105> words <WH1697>, O thou deceitful <WH4820> tongue <WH3956>.

God <WH410> will likewise destroy <WH5422> thee for ever <WH5331>; He will take thee up <WH2846>, and pluck thee out <WH5255> of thy tent <WH168>, And root thee out <WH8327> of the land <WH776> of the living <WH2416>. <WH5542>[[Selah
The righteous <WH6662> also shall see <WH7200> it <WH3372>, and fear, And shall laugh at him <WH7832>, saying,

Lo <WH1397>, this is the man that made <WH7760> not God <WH430> his strength <WH4581>, But trusted <WH982> in the abundance <WH7230> of his riches <WH6239>, And strengthened <WH5810> himself in his wickedness <WH1942>.
But as for me <WH7488>, I am like a green olive-tree <WH2132> in the house <WH1004> of God <WH430>: I trust <WH982> in the lovingkindness <WH2617> of God <WH430> for ever <WH5703> and ever <WH5769>.
I will give thee thanks <WH3034> for ever <WH5769>, because thou hast done <WH6213> it <WH6960>; And I will hope in thy name <WH8034>, for it is good <WH2896>, in the presence of thy saints <WH2623>.
